com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter

Class PeerApplicationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.configuration.AbstractConfigurable
      • com.camerontec.catalys.server.component.ComponentHelper
        • com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.PeerApplicationManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPeerApplicationManager, IPeerApplicationReader, IPeerApplicationWriter, IComponent, IHasAttributes, IConfigurable, IRegisterable

    public final class PeerApplicationManager
extends ComponentHelper
implements IPeerApplicationManager
    Default IPeerApplicationManager implementation.

    This class:

    • Manages a single instance of IPeerApplicationWriter and IPeerApplicationReader
    • Ensures that the managed reader and writer are used in a thread safe way
    • Delegates calls via either of the above interfaces to the appropriate managed instance.

      • closeComponent

        public boolean closeComponent()
                       throws Exception
        Description copied from class: ComponentHelper
        If the component is already closed, this method does nothing. Otherwise it marks the component as closed (ie not open) and unregisters it from the ComponentRegistry
        Specified by:
        closeComponent in interface IComponent
        Overrides:
        closeComponent in class ComponentHelper
        Returns:
        Previous open state.
        Throws:
        Exception - if it was unable to completely close. It should not throw an exception until it has closed itself as fully as possible.

      • refreshStateFromAttributes

        public void refreshStateFromAttributes()

        Specified by:

      • read

        public IPeerApplicationResultSet read()
                               throws PeerApplicationException
        Description copied from interface: IPeerApplicationReader
        Read an object from the peer application.

        This method must not return any objects previously marked as being sent or being in error via the IPeerApplicationResultSet.markAsSent() and IPeerApplicationResultSet.markAsError(java.lang.Object) methods respectively.

        Specified by:
        read in interface IPeerApplicationReader
        Returns:
        A result set containing zero or more objects.
        Throws:
        PeerApplicationException - On error.
